titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Barbara S. Buckley Papers, 1941-1959
titlestmt.author: Inventory prepared by Janine St. Germain

publicationstmt.publisher: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Laura Streett, 2016

did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Barbara S. Buckley Papers

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

did.abstract: Collection consists primarily of musical compositions, both original manuscripts and copy prints, as well as a small volume of correspondence, press clippings, writings and biographical documentation.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Barbara S. Buckley (Mallinckrodt) was born in Wilmington, Delaware and was both a musician (piano, violin and flute) and composer. She studied at the American School at Fontainebleau under the direction of Nadia Boulanger. Buckley also studied at Boston University, Vassar College (Class of 1945), and Bryn Mawr (1941). Her compositions include a symphony, string quartets, chamber music for strings and piano, solo piano works, a work for solo organ, songs, sacred choral music, and chamber music for winds or brass.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Barbara S. Buckley Papers, 1941 - 1959, contain Buckley’s musical compositions, both original manuscripts and photostat copies. Files include her notations and sketches for works created between 1948 and 1959. One letter sized document box contains four folders of correspondence, one of which includes a note from Buckley’s mentor, Nadia Boulanger. Files include press clippings, programs, and two folders of writings by Buckley, possibly from her work as an undergraduate student. One reference folder contains inventory lists describing the collection’s contents, one created at the time of the collection’s accession to Vassar College (including lyrics of selected pieces), and one handwritten collection of inventory lists, circa 1950s.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research according to the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library without any additional restrictions.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to quote (publish) from unpublished or previously published material must be obtained as described in the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Janine St. Germain, June 2017.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Barbara S. Buckley Papers, Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into seven series. Compositions are arranged alphabetically, as titled by the creator.
